intro: Diodia virginiana, commonly known as wild betony, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Diodia virginiana is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
